page.title: 01South of Maybole
page.content: The train is left behind and the minor road, with tracks to farms crosses the area of farmland with sheep and cattle grazing peacefully. They are disturbed only by the train on the single track railway on its way to Stranraer or Glasgow. There are areas of mixed woodland & heathland with rocky outcrops and streams. A major road crosses the outer fringe in the west and a minor road in the east, on these are the only shops, farm shops supplying meat to local & passing trade. The buildings are farm houses and cottages, one farm Kilkenzie Castle dates from 16-17th century, one cottage a dealer in scrap metal, rusting bodies of cars surrounded by the sounds of running water and birds.
